title: Misleading XDMP-REQUTF8SEQ 500 Error response when the request has a malformed query string
description:
Send a MarkLogic server and URL like http://foo/bar.xqy?q=%E7

Note that %E7 is not a valid character in UTF-8.  (In latin-1 it is lower case c with a cedilla).

The server sends back an inappropriate 500 Error with

XDMP-REQUTF8SEQ: Invalid UTF-8 escape sequence -- request headers are not UTF-8 encoded
in /browse.xqy [0.9-ml]

In truth, there is an invalid escape sequence in the status line (query string) and not the request headers.

Also, this request should not really generate a 500 error.  (Try an URL like that at apache httpd or google for example).  Appropriate behavior more inline with the 2616 rfc would be to log an error or warning and simply skip over the invalid bits (or the entire query string).  500 errors are intended for actual internal failures/errors as opposed to bad incoming data.  Another choice would be to send a 400 (Bad request) response (which, when seen in a deployment, can safely be ignored).

I"m reporting this against 3.2 and 4.0.

support.headline: Misleading XDMP-REQUTF8SEQ 500 Error response when the request has a malformed query string
support.supportDescription: When sending a request containing an invalid character in UTF-8 in query string to MarkLogic server, the server sends back an inappropriate 500 Error: XDMP-REQUTF8SEQ: Invalid UTF-8 escape sequence -- request headers are not UTF-8 encoded

changeHistory.comment: This may also exist in 4.0 and 4.1 but this bug is filed for logging purposes and there is no real need to fix.

Fwiw, I see several of these (or more) each day at Mark Mail - it would really be nice to fix the reporting (at least in 4.2) as I have to look at each 500 error when they come in to determine whether or not it's a real problem.

I am getting hit with this on DMC every day now via bogus php attack urls - they are causing MarkLogic to send 500 errors erroneously.  DMC is currently running 5.0 - I don't know why Sidney said there was no need to fix, although it is not a high priority issue.

I am not sure why this got put in never-never land.  I moved it to 5.0-5.  You can reproduce this against any MarkLogic instance with the following:

curl --anyauth admin:password -X GET http://localhost:8000/?q=%E7
assign to Chonghai?  Haitao can lead him to do it.
Chonghai, you can get leadership from Haitao on this.

I found that Unicode::isUTF8() did not work correctly. When this function checks "/foo.xqy?q=%E7" or "%E7", it returns true. "%E7" is not a valid character in UTF-8. If Unicode::isUTF8() works fine, then the error in this bug should not exist.

The isUTF8() function is not the problem here.
The isUTF8() function validates whether a string is valid UTF-8.
The string “%E7” contains the bytes %, E and 7, a perfectly valid sequence of bytes for a UTF-8 encoded string.
It is not the job of isUTF8() to valid whether a string is valid URL-encoded UTF-8.
bug:8976 update the code to send a 400 response for the request
I misunderstood isUTF8() function. It works correctly. I have updated the code and now a 400 response will be sent for this request.
